Apple___Apple_scab.symptoms: Dark, scabby lesions on leaves, fruit, and twigs. Leaves may become distorted and fall prematurely.
Apple___Apple_scab.treatment: Apply fungicides during wet weather. Remove infected leaves and fruit. Plant resistant varieties.
Apple___Apple_scab.fun_fact: Apple scab is caused by the fungus Venturia inaequalis and thrives in cool, wet conditions.

Apple___Black_rot.symptoms: Brown, circular spots on leaves. Rotted areas on fruit with concentric rings. Cankers on branches.
Apple___Black_rot.treatment: Prune infected branches. Apply fungicides. Remove mummified fruits from trees.
Apple___Black_rot.fun_fact: Black rot can cause fruit to completely rot and mummify on the tree.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.symptoms: Bright orange or yellow spots on leaves. Galls form on cedar trees in winter.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.treatment: Remove nearby cedar trees. Apply fungicides in spring. Plant resistant apple varieties.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.fun_fact: This disease requires both apple and cedar trees to complete its life cycle.

Apple___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and pruning practices.
Apple___healthy.fun_fact: Apples are members of the rose family (Rosaceae).

Blueberry___healthy.treatment: Maintain acidic soil (pH 4.5-5.5) and consistent moisture.
Blueberry___healthy.fun_fact: Blueberries are one of the few naturally blue foods.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White, powdery fungal growth on leaves, shoots, and fruit. Leaves may curl and become distorted.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply sulfur or fungicides. Prune for better air circulation. Remove infected plant parts.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.fun_fact: Powdery mildew can spread rapidly in warm, dry climates with high humidity at night.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper watering and fertilization. Prune to improve air circulation.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.fun_fact: Cherries contain melatonin, which may help regulate sleep patterns.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.symptoms: Rectangular, gray to tan lesions on leaves between leaf veins. Lesions may merge causing leaf death.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.treatment: Apply fungicides. Rotate crops. Use resistant hybrids. Till crop residue into soil.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.fun_fact: Gray leaf spot is more severe in conservation tillage systems where corn residue remains on the surface.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.symptoms: Small, circular to elongate reddish-brown pustules on both leaf surfaces. Leaves may yellow and die early.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.treatment: Plant resistant hybrids. Apply fungicides if necessary. Remove infected plant debris.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.fun_fact: Common rust pustules can produce millions of spores that spread by wind.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.symptoms: Long, elliptical gray-green lesions on leaves. Lesions can be 1-6 inches long.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.treatment: Use resistant hybrids. Apply fungicides. Rotate crops. Bury crop debris.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.fun_fact: Northern Leaf Blight can reduce corn yields by up to 30% in susceptible varieties.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper watering and fertilization. Monitor for pests and diseases.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.fun_fact: Corn is used in over 4,000 products, from food to fuel and plastics.

Grape___Black_rot.symptoms: Circular brown spots on leaves with dark borders. Fruit develops light brown spots that turn into black, shriveled mummies.
Grape___Black_rot.treatment: Remove mummified fruit. Apply fungicides. Prune for air circulation. Remove infected leaves.
Grape___Black_rot.fun_fact: Black rot mummies can harbor the fungus for up to two years.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).symptoms: Tiger-stripe patterns on leaves. Dark streaking in wood. Berries may show dark spots.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).treatment: Prune infected wood. No effective fungicides available. Remove severely infected vines.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).fun_fact: Esca is an ancient disease mentioned in Greek and Roman texts about viticulture.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.symptoms: Small, angular brown spots on leaves. Spots may have yellow halos. Heavy infection causes defoliation.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.treatment: Apply fungicides. Remove infected leaves. Improve air circulation through pruning.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.fun_fact: This disease is most common in humid, tropical, and subtropical regions.

Grape___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper pruning, watering, and fertilization practices.
Grape___healthy.fun_fact: There are over 10,000 varieties of grapes worldwide.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).symptoms: Yellow shoots, mottled leaves, lopsided fruit with green ends. Fruit is bitter and drops prematurely.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).treatment: Remove infected trees immediately. Control psyllid insects. Plant disease-free nursery stock.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).fun_fact: Huanglongbing (HLB) is one of the most devastating citrus diseases and has no cure.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, purple spots on leaves that become brown and fall out leaving holes. Fruit has raised dark spots.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper sprays. Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead irrigation.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.fun_fact: Bacterial spot is spread by rain splash and can survive in leaf debris.

Peach___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper pruning, thinning, and fertilization practices.
Peach___healthy.fun_fact: Peaches are native to China and have been cultivated for over 4,000 years.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, raised brown spots on leaves and fruit. Spots may have yellow halos. Leaves may drop.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use disease-free seeds. Apply copper-based sprays. Rotate crops. Remove infected plants.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.fun_fact: Bacterial spot can survive in seed and plant debris for months.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper watering and fertilization. Ensure good air circulation.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.fun_fact: Bell peppers are actually fruits, not vegetables, and contain more vitamin C than oranges.

Potato___Early_blight.symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings (target pattern) on older leaves. Leaves turn yellow and die.
Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides. Rotate crops. Remove infected plant debris. Use certified disease-free seed potatoes.
Potato___Early_blight.fun_fact: Early blight is more common in warm, humid weather and can reduce yields by 20-30%.

Potato___Late_blight.symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves that turn brown and black. White mold growth on undersides. Tubers develop brown rot.
Potato___Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides preventatively. Remove infected plants immediately. Plant resistant varieties.
Potato___Late_blight.fun_fact: Late blight caused the Irish Potato Famine in the 1840s, killing over 1 million people.

Potato___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper soil moisture and fertilization. Use certified seed potatoes.
Potato___healthy.fun_fact: Potatoes are the world's fourth-largest food crop after rice, wheat, and corn.

Raspberry___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper watering, fertilization, and pruning practices.
Raspberry___healthy.fun_fact: Raspberries are a rich source of antioxidants and vitamin C.

Soybean___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper watering and fertilization. Monitor for pests.
Soybean___healthy.fun_fact: Soybeans are a complete protein source and contain all nine essential amino acids.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.symptoms: White, powdery fungal growth on leaves and stems. Leaves may yellow and die prematurely.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply fungicides or sulfur. Remove infected leaves. Plant resistant varieties. Improve air circulation.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.fun_fact: Powdery mildew can spread rapidly in warm, dry days and cool, humid nights.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.symptoms: Purple to brown spots on leaves with reddish-purple borders. Leaf centers turn brown and die.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides. Plant resistant varieties. Avoid overhead irrigation.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.fun_fact: Leaf scorch is most severe during hot, dry weather.

Strawberry___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper watering and fertilization. Mulch to prevent soil-borne diseases.
Strawberry___healthy.fun_fact: Strawberries are the only fruit with seeds on the outside.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.symptoms: Small, dark brown spots on leaves with yellow halos. Raised spots on fruit. Severe defoliation may occur.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Use disease-free seeds. Apply copper sprays. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead watering.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.fun_fact: Bacterial spot can reduce tomato yields by up to 50% in severe cases.

Tomato___Early_blight.symptoms: Brown spots with concentric rings on lower leaves. Leaves yellow and drop. Dark lesions on stems and fruit.
Tomato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides. Remove infected leaves. Mulch to prevent soil splash. Rotate crops.
Tomato___Early_blight.fun_fact: Early blight is caused by the fungus Alternaria solani and is most common mid-season.

Tomato___Late_blight.symptoms: Large, irregular brown lesions on leaves with white mold on undersides. Rapid plant death. Fruit develops brown, greasy spots.
Tomato___Late_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides preventatively. Remove infected plants. Avoid overhead watering. Plant resistant varieties.
Tomato___Late_blight.fun_fact: Late blight can destroy an entire tomato crop in days under favorable conditions.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaf surfaces. Olive-green to brown fuzzy mold on lower surfaces. Leaves curl and die.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.treatment: Improve air circulation. Apply fungicides. Remove infected leaves. Lower humidity in greenhouses.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.fun_fact: Leaf mold thrives in high humidity (above 85%) and is common in greenhouses.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.symptoms: Small, circular spots with dark borders and gray centers on leaves. Tiny black dots (fungal bodies) visible in centers.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides. Mulch to prevent soil splash. Rotate crops.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.fun_fact: Septoria leaf spot can reduce tomato yields by up to 50% by causing severe defoliation.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.symptoms: Yellow stippling on leaves. Fine webbing on undersides. Leaves may bronze and drop. Severe infestations stunt growth.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.treatment: Spray with water to dislodge mites. Apply insecticidal soap or horticultural oil. Use predatory mites.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.fun_fact: Spider mites are arachnids (related to spiders), not insects, and thrive in hot, dry conditions.

Tomato___Target_Spot.symptoms: Brown spots with concentric rings on leaves, stems, and fruit. Spots may have yellow halos.
Tomato___Target_Spot.treatment: Apply fungicides. Remove infected plant parts. Improve air circulation. Avoid overhead watering.
Tomato___Target_Spot.fun_fact: Target spot is caused by the fungus Corynespora cassiicola and is favored by warm, humid conditions.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.symptoms: Severe leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth. Reduced fruit set. Plants appear bushy.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.treatment: Control whitefly vectors with insecticides. Remove infected plants. Use reflective mulches. Plant resistant varieties.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.fun_fact: This virus is spread exclusively by whiteflies and can devastate tomato crops.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.symptoms: Mottled light and dark green pattern on leaves. Leaf distortion. Fruit may have brown spots or uneven ripening.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: Remove infected plants. Disinfect tools. Use virus-free seeds. Control aphids. Wash hands after handling tobacco.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.fun_fact: Tomato mosaic virus can survive in soil and plant debris for up to 2 years.

Tomato___healthy.treatment: Maintain proper watering and fertilization. Provide support for vines.
Tomato___healthy.fun_fact: Tomatoes are technically a fruit and contain more genes than humans (31,000 vs 25,000).
